alert.note: Alert for Androscoggin; Kennebec; Southern Franklin; Southern Oxford (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 14 at 2:54PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Kennebec, northeastern Androscoggin and southeastern Franklin Counties through 345 PM EDT... At 253 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Livermore Falls, or 14 miles south of Farmington, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Farmington, Oakland, Turner, Jay, Belgrade, Livermore Falls, Manchester, Canton, Winthrop, Wilton, Leeds, Livermore, Chesterville, Hartford, Fayette, Wayne, Rome, Mount Vernon, Readfield and Vienna. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Androscoggin; Kennebec; Southern Franklin; Southern Oxford
